alert.note: Alert for Caldwell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 9:51PM EDT until September 30 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following county, Caldwell. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 949 PM EDT, Doppler radar continued to show encroaching and redeveloping heavy showers across the region. It is possible that as much as 2.5 or 3 inches of rain will accumulate through late evening. This additional rainfall may be enough to elevate stream levels and perhaps flood a few low-lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hickory, Lenoir, Sawmills, Granite Falls, Gamewell, Hudson, Cajah`s Mountain, Blowing Rock In Caldwell County, Rhodhiss, Cedar Rock, Lake Rhodhiss, Lake Hickory, Grandfather Mountain State Park, B.R. Parkway-Linville Falls To Grandfather, Patterson, Collettsville, Kings Creek, Upton, Globe and Edgemont. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
